description: Explore the world of books, authors, and literary masterpieces

questions.question: Who wrote 'Pride and Prejudice'?
questions.funFact: Jane Austen sold the copyright to 'Pride and Prejudice' for only £110 (about $10,000 today)!
questions.story: Published in 1813, 'Pride and Prejudice' was originally titled 'First Impressions'. Austen wrote the first draft at just 21 years old, and it took 17 years before it was finally published, becoming one of the most beloved novels in English literature.

questions.question: What is the first book of J.R.R. Tolkien's 'The Lord of the Rings' trilogy?
questions.funFact: Tolkien created entire languages for his books, including Elvish, which has its own grammar rules and alphabet!
questions.story: Tolkien began writing 'The Lord of the Rings' as a sequel to 'The Hobbit', but it evolved into something much larger. He spent over 12 years writing the trilogy, drawing from his experiences in World War I and his deep knowledge of ancient languages and mythology.

questions.question: Which Shakespeare play features the line 'To be, or not to be'?
questions.funFact: The role of Hamlet has about 1,530 lines, the longest of any Shakespearean character!
questions.story: This famous soliloquy appears in Act 3, Scene 1 of Hamlet, where the prince contemplates existence and death. The play was written between 1599 and 1601, during what scholars call Shakespeare's 'tragic period', and is considered one of his greatest masterpieces.
